member.name: N:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask
member.summary: The namespace contains the interfaces and classes used for the WMI Event Watcher Task, which uses Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to return information about WMI events that occur on a computer system. For more information about the WMI Event Watcher Task, see WMI Event Watcher Task.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.ActionAtEvent
member.summary: Determines the action taken by the when the task receives the specified Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.ActionAtEvent.LogTheEvent
member.summary: Logs the event notification and the status specified in to the specified log.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.ActionAtEvent.LogTheEventAndFireDTSEvent
member.summary: Raises a custom DTS event indicating that the WMI event occurred and providing any information associated with the WMI event in Managed Object Format (MOF), and then logs the event notification and the status specified in to the specified log.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.ActionAtTimeout
member.summary: Determines how the responds when the task times out without receiving the specified Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.ActionAtTimeout.LogTimeout
member.summary: Logs the timeout and the status specified in to the specified log.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.ActionAtTimeout.LogTimeoutAndFireDTSEvent
member.summary: Raises a custom DTS event indicating that the WMI event timed out, and then logs the timeout and the status specified in to the specified log.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.AfterEvent
member.summary: Determines how the responds when the task receives the specified Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.AfterEvent.ReturnWithFailure
member.summary: Logs that the user chose to treat the event notification as a failure, and stops waiting for the logged event. This is the default value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.AfterEvent.ReturnWithSuccess
member.summary: Logs that the user chose to treat the event notification as a success, and stops waiting for the logged event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.AfterEvent.WatchfortheEventAgain
member.summary: Logs that the user chose to continue waiting for the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.AfterTimeout
member.summary: Determines how the responds when the task times out without receiving the specified Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.AfterTimeout.ReturnWithFailure
member.summary: Logs that the user chose to treat the timeout as a failure, and stops waiting for the logged event. This is the default value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.AfterTimeout.ReturnWithSuccess
member.summary: Logs that the user chose to treat the timeout as a success, and stops waiting for the logged event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.AfterTimeout.WatchfortheEventAgain
member.summary: Logs that the user chose to continue waiting for the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.QuerySourceType
member.summary: Determines the source type of the property, which provides the Windows Management Instrumentation Query Language (WQL) query to be executed by the class.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.QuerySourceType.DirectInput
member.summary: contains the WQL query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.QuerySourceType.FileConnection
member.summary: contains the name of a file connection from which to retrieve the WQL query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.QuerySourceType.Variable
member.summary: contains the name of a variable from which to retrieve the WQL query.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask
member.summary: Contains the members used to configure and run a WMI Event Watcher task, which runs Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) queries and returns WMI data about a computer system. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.AcceptBreakpointManager(Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.BreakpointManager)
member.summary: Passes a reference to the task. This method is called by the runtime and is not used in code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.Execute(Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.Connections,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.VariableDispenser,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSComponentEvents,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSLogging,System.Object)
member.summary: Runs the task.
member.returns: A that indicates the outcome of the execution.
member.param: A reference to an object that implements the interface for raising events.
A reference to an object that implements .
The transaction object that the task is part of, depending on the value found in the TransactionOption property. This value can be set to a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.summary: Initializes the properties associated with the task. This method is called by the runtime and is not used in code.
member.param: An object that implements the interface for receiving events.
An object that implements the interface for logging events.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.LoadFromXML(System.Xml.XmlElement,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSInfoEvents)
member.summary: This method is not callable by your application code. To load a package saved as .xml, use the method.
member.param: The XML element that contains the information to load.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.ResumeExecution
member.summary: Resumes execution of the task after pausing. The task or container is resumed by the runtime engine.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.SaveToXML(System.Xml.XmlDocument,Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Runtime.IDTSInfoEvents)
member.summary: This method is not callable by your application code. To save a package as .xml, use the method.
member.param: The XML document that contains the XML element representing the task.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.SuspendExecution
member.summary: Indicates that the executable needs to suspend. This method is called by the runtime engine.

member.summary: Verifies that the task is properly configured.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.DebugMode
member.summary: A Boolean indicating whether should check if breakpoints are enabled.
member.returns: true if the task should check for enabled breakpoints; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.ExecutionValue
member.summary: Gets an Object that contains the results of the task.
member.returns: An Object that contains the results of the task.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.NumberOfEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) events for which the should watch.
member.returns: An Integer containing the number of WMI events for which the task should watch. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.SuspendRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that indicates if tasks should suspend when they encounter a breakpoint. This value is set by the runtime engine for tasks and containers when a breakpoint is encountered.
member.returns: true if the task suspends when it encounters a breakpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds the task should wait to receive a Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) event before timing out.
member.returns: An Integer containing the number of seconds the task should wait to receive a WMI event before timing out. If set to zero (0), the task waits indefinitely. The default value is zero (0).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the class used by the task.
member.returns: The name of the class associated with the task.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.WqlQuerySource
member.summary: Gets or sets the source of the Windows Management Instrumentation Query Language (WQL) query to be executed by the .
member.returns: A String containing the source of the WQL query.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Dts.Tasks.WmiEventWatcherTask.WmiEventWatcherTask.WqlQuerySourceType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the source type, such as file connection or a variable, of the Windows Management Instrumentation Query Language (WQL) query to be executed by the .
